Comments_List:
I have learned how to read an image without referring to texts. It enables me to reflect on the difference of textual logic and the visual logic. And it does help in English writing.
Also important is how to appreciate Tibetan Buddhist images, which is important in understanding Tibetan culture and also esoteric Buddhism.
I learned about how to analyze the religious painting and the reverence to the Buddha through the paintings.

The course's reading materials are carefully selected and can benefit us a lot in understanding visual arts and Tibetan Buddhism.
The assignment is also well designed, and the atmosphere is relaxed. We are encouraged to raise questions and engage in the discussion. The presentation part is also a great opportunity to help us build the skills of giving a speech.
The final project is excellent. It is perhaps the first time we are involved in a real research project and it is a pioneering work.
If this course is only open for graduate students, it may go deeper in its contents.

Strengths: so many materials and deep discussion, and insightful readings. And the wonderful experience of seeing ancient Tangkas.

Weaknesses: maybe we could learn more techniques and methods to analyze religious paintings and Tangkas.
Yes. I would recommend it to anyone interested in mysticism or visual culture.
I would like to recommend this course to another student. It's interesting and insightful. Such a rare experience to analyze the great Tibetan paintings.
